parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required path parameter as integer which uniquely identify the {@link PlayerLevel}.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description:
The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation,
to which this player level belongs to.

post.description:
Creates a new text message as a present in a gamificated application, so the method
generates the Present-id. The organisation's API key is mandatory otherwise a warning
with the hint for a non valid API key is returned.
By the creation the player-id of the sender and a list of the receiver ids are needed to
be passed. Additionally the content of the text message has to be passed.
It is checked, if the ids of the players are positive numbers otherwise a message for the
invalid number is returned.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description:
The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation,
to which this text message belongs to.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: The content of the text message.

parameters.name: playerId
parameters.description:
The player who sends the text message as a present to other players. This
field must not be null.

parameters.name: receiverIds
parameters.description: The player ids of the present's receivers. This field must not be null.

delete.description:
Removes the specific present with the assigned id from data base. It is checked, if the passed
id is a positive number otherwise a message for an invalid number is returned. If the API key
is not valid an analogous message is returned.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required path parameter as integer which uniquely identify the {@link Present}.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description:
The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation,
to which this present belongs to.

get.description:
This method returns all image messages of a specific player's current presents and which are
associated with the given API key and so all text messages which belong to the associated
organisation. If the API key is not valid an analogous message is returned.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description:
The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation,
to which the image messages belongs to.

parameters.name: playerId
parameters.description:
The id of the player who owns the board with the current presents. This field
must not be null.

get.description:
Returns all presents from player's current presents as list of present-objects.
These presents were accepted by the player so they were moved from the inbox to the
list of current presents.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description:
The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation,
to which this present belongs to.

parameters.name: playerId
parameters.description: The id of the player whose current presents are returned. This field must not be null.

get.description:
This method returns all presents of a player's inbox associated with the given API key and so
all presents who belong to the associated organisation. If the API key is not valid an analogous
message is returned.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description:
The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation,
to which this present belongs to.

parameters.name: playerId
parameters.description: The id of the player whose presents are returned. This field must not be null.

post.description:
With this method one present is sent to all specified receivers. So the present is stored
in each inbox of the receivers.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description:
The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation,
to which this present belongs to.

parameters.name: presentId
parameters.description: The path parameter of the present's id that should be sent to the receivers.

get.description:
This method returns all text messages of a specific player's current presents and which are
associated with the given API key and so all text messages which belong to the associated
organisation. If the API key is not valid an analogous message is returned.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description:
The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation,
to which the text messages belongs to.

parameters.name: playerId
parameters.description:
The id of the player who owns the board with the current presents. This field
must not be null.

post.description:
With this method a player accepts a present. So the present will be moved from her/his inbox
to the list of the player's current presents.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description:
The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation,
to which this present belongs to.

parameters.name: playerId
parameters.description: The id of the player who accepts the present. This field must not be null.

parameters.name: presentId
parameters.description: The present that is accepted. This field must not be null.

post.description:
Creates a new image message as a present in a gamificated application, so the method
generates the Present-id. The organisation's API key is mandatory otherwise a warning
with the hint for a non valid API key is returned.
By the creation the player-id of the sender and a list of the receiver ids are needed to
be passed. These id have to be separated by commas. Additionally the image path of the
image has to be passed. The format of the image has to be .jpg or .png.
It is checked, if the ids of the players are positive numbers otherwise a message for the
invalid number is returned.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description:
The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation,
to which this image message belongs to.

parameters.name: imagePath
parameters.description:
The path of the image. This field must not be null and the format of the image
has to be .jpg or .png.

parameters.name: playerId
parameters.description:
The player who sends the image message as a present to other players. This
field must not be null.

parameters.name: receiverIds
parameters.description: The player ids of the present's receivers. This field must not be null.

post.description:
With this method on present is archived. So the present is moved from the player's list of
current presents to an list of archived presents on the board.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description:
The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation,
to which this present belongs to.

parameters.name: playerId
parameters.description: The id of the player who archived the present. This field must not be null.

parameters.name: presentId
parameters.description: The present that is archived. This field must not be null.

get.description:
Returns all presents from player's list of archived presents as list of present-objects.
These presents are accepted presents which the player wanted to archive.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description:
The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation,
to which this present belongs to.

parameters.name: playerId
parameters.description: The id of the player whose current presents are returned. This field must not be null.

post.description:
With this method a player denies a present. So the present will be deleted from her/his
inbox of the board.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description:
The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation,
to which this present belongs to.

parameters.name: playerId
parameters.description: The id of the player who denies the present. This field must not be null.

parameters.name: presentId
parameters.description: The present that is denied. This field must not be null.

post.description:
Creates a new reward of type badge so the method generates its reward-id. The
organisation's API key is mandatory otherwise a warning with the hint for a non valid
API key is returned. Optionally the URL for an icon can be passed and a description for
the badge.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description:
The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation,
to which this reward belongs to.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Optionally a short text can be set to describe the badge.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The required name of the badge.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Optionally the URL of an image can be set that is associated with the badge.

put.description:
With this method the fields of one specific coin reward can be changed. For this the
reward id, the API key of the specific organisation, the name of the field and the
new field's value are needed.
To modify the amount of coins the new amount has to be transfered with the attribute
field.
If the API key is not valid an analogous message is returned. It is also checked, if
the id is a positive number otherwise a message for an invalid number is returned.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required integer which uniquely identify the {@link Reward}.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description:
The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation,
to which this reward belongs to.

parameters.name: attribute
parameters.description:
The name of the attribute which should be modified. This parameter is required.
The following names of attributes can be used to change the associated field:
"amount".

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The new value of the attribute. This parameter is required.

post.description:
Creates a new reward and so the method generates the reward-id. The organisation's API
key is mandatory otherwise a warning with the hint for a non valid API key is returned.
It has to be defined which type of reward should be created, its name, description and
respectively it is a permanent or a volatile reward an URL for the icon or the amount
of coins or points.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description:
If the type is a volatile reward like points or coins this parameter is used
to represent their amount.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description:
The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation,
to which this reward belongs to.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Optionally the description of the reward as String.

parameters.name: icon
parameters.description:
If the type is a permanent reward like a badge or achievement this parameter
represents the URL of the associated image.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: A string that represents the name of the reward.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
The required type of the reward. A list of available reward types
can be received by {@link RewardApi#getRewardTypes}.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description:

post.description:
Creates a new reward of type points so the method generates its reward-id. The
organisation's API key is mandatory otherwise a warning with the hint for a non valid
API key is returned.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: The required amount of points greater then zero that can be earned.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description:
The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation,
to which this reward belongs to.

get.description:
Gets a specific role of an organisation so the id of the organisation and its API key are needed.
If the API key is not valid an analogous message is returned. It is also checked, if the id is a positive
number otherwise a message for an invalid number is returned.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required path parameter id of the role that should be gotten. This parameter is required.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description:
The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation,
to which this role belongs to.

delete.description:
Deletes a specific role of an organisation so the id of the organisation and its API key are needed.
If the API key is not valid an analogous message is returned. It is also checked, if the id is a positive
number otherwise a message for an invalid number is returned.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required path parameter id of the role that should be gotten. This parameter is required.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description:
The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation,
to which this role belongs to.

get.description:
Gets all roles of a specific organisation that have been created. If the API key is not
valid an analogous message is returned.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description:
The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation,
to which this role belongs to. This field must not be null.

put.description:
With this method the name field of one role can be changed. For this the id of the role, the API key of the
specific organisation, the name of the field and the new value are needed.
If the API key is not valid an analogous message is returned.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the role that should be changed. This parameter is required.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description:
The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation,
to which this role belongs to.

parameters.name: attribute
parameters.description:
The name of the attribute which should be changed.  This parameter is required.
The following names of attributes can be used to change the associated field:
"name".

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The new value of the attribute. This parameter is required.

post.description:
Creates a new role for the organisation to which the API key belongs to. Because
of this API key the created role is specific to this organisation.
If the API key is not valid an analogous message is returned.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description:
The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation,
to which this role belongs to.

parameters.name: roleName
parameters.description: The required name of the new role. This field must not be null.

post.description:
Creates a new points rule. By the creation the amount of points which has to be reached to fulfil the
goal and also its name are needed. A description can also be made.
If a goal is associated with a points rule and is also repeatable the goal will be added once only to the
player's or respectively group's list of already finished goals. The rewards of such a goal are also awarded
only once. So a points rule can be fulfilled once only although the associated goal is repeatable.
If the API key is not valid an analogous message is returned. It is also checked, if the id is a positive
number otherwise a message for an invalid number is returned.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description:
The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation,
to which this rule belongs to.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description:
Optionally the description of the rule can be passed. This can help the player to understand
which tasks she/he to fulfil.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the task rule. This parameter is required.

parameters.name: points
parameters.description: The amount of points which should be reached.

get.description:
This method gets one specific goal rule which is identified by the given id and the API key.
If the API key is not valid an analogous message is returned. It is also checked, if the
id is a positive number otherwise a message for an invalid number is returned.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required integer as path parameter which uniquely identify the goal rule.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description:
The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation,
to which this rule belongs to.

delete.description:
Removes a specific goal rule from the data base which is identified by the given id and the
API key. If the API key is not valid an analogous message is returned. It is also checked,
if the id is a positive number otherwise a message for an invalid number is returned.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required integer as path parameter which uniquely identify the goal rule.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description:
The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation,
to which this rule belongs to.

get.description:
This method collects all available rules associated with the given API key and so all goal rules which
belong to the associated organisation. If the API key is not valid an analogous message
is returned.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description:
The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation,
to which this rule belongs to.

post.description:
Creates a new task rule. By the creation the type of rule (DoAllTasksRule or DoAnyTaskRule) has to be defined, the rule's name,
description and the ids which should be associated with this rule.
If the API key is not valid an analogous message is returned. It is also checked, if the id is a positive
number otherwise a message for an invalid number is returned.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description:
The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation,
to which this rule belongs to.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description:
Optionally the description of the rule can be passed. This can help the player to understand
which tasks she/he to fulfil.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the task rule. This parameter is required.

parameters.name: tasks
parameters.description:
The list of task ids that are have to be respective can be fulfilled to complete the goal.
These ids are separated by commas.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
The type of the task rule, this can be "DoAllTasksRule" or "DoAnyTaskRule".
This field must not be null.

put.description:
With this method the fields of one specific goal rule can be changed. For this the
goal rule id, the API key of the specific organisation, the name of the field and
the new field's value are needed.
To modify the name or description of the goal rule the new string has to be passed
with the attribute field. If the
If the API key is not valid an analogous message is returned. It is also checked,
if the id is a positive number otherwise a message for an invalid number is returned.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the goal rule that should be changed. This parameter is required.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description:
The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation,
to which this goal rule belongs to.

parameters.name: attribute
parameters.description:
The name of the attribute which should be modified. This parameter is required.
The following names of attributes can be used to change the associated field:
"description", "name" and if it is a GetPointsRule additionally "points".

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The new value of the attribute. This parameter is required.

get.description:
Returns the task associated with the passed id and API key. If the API key is not
valid an analogous message is returned. It is also checked, if the player id is a
positive number otherwise a message for an invalid number is returned.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required path parameter as integer which uniquely identify the {@link Task}.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description:
The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation,
to which this task belongs to.

delete.description:
Removes the task with the assigned id and associated API key from data base. It is checked,
if the passed id is a positive number otherwise a message for an invalid number is returned.
If the API key is not valid an analogous message is returned.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required integer which uniquely identify the {@link Task}.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description:
The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation,
to which this task belongs to.

put.description:
With this method the fields of a Task can be changed. For this the id of the
task, the API key of the specific organisation, the name of the field and the new
value are needed.
To modify the name or the description the new String has to be passed with the
attribute field. A new list of roles can be passed when their ids are separated by
commas. Also the task can be set tradeable or not by passing the value true or false.
If the API key is not valid an analogous message is returned. It is also checked, if
the ids are a positive number otherwise a message for an invalid number is returned.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task that should be changed. This parameter is required.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description:
The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation,
to which this task belongs to.

parameters.name: attribute
parameters.description:
The name of the attribute which should be modified. This parameter is required.
The following names of attributes can be used to change the associated field:
"taskName", "description", "tradeable" and "roles".

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The new value of the attribute. This parameter is required.

post.description:
Creates a new task and so the method generates the task-id. The organisation's API key
is mandatory otherwise a warning with the hint for a non valid API key is returned.
By the creation values for its name, a short description what have to done and the roles
who are allowed to complete the task.
It is checked, if the id of the roles are positive numbers otherwise a message for the
invalid number is returned.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description:
The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation,
to which this task belongs to.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description:
Optional a short description can be set. This can be for example explain what
a player has to do to complete the task.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the task. This parameter is required.

parameters.name: roleIds
parameters.description:
Optionally a list of role ids separated by commas who are allowed to fulfil the
task.

parameters.name: tradeable
parameters.description:
This field specifies whether the task is tradeable or not. The default value is
set to not tradeable (false).

post.description:
This method completes a task with the assigned id and associated API key. The player-id
represents the player who has completed the task. The task is added to the list of
finished tasks of this player. Thereby the task becomes a finished task object and the
time and date is also stored when the task was officially be done.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required integer which uniquely identify the {@link Task}.

parameters.name: playerId
parameters.description: The if ot the player who has completed the task. This parameter is required.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description:
The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation,
to which this task belongs to.

parameters.name: finishedDate
parameters.description:
Optionally the local tate time can be passed when the task was finished. If the
value is null, the finshedDate is set to the time and date when the query was
sent.

get.description:
Returns a list of all tasks associated with the passed API key. If the key is not
valid an analogous message is returned.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description:
The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation,
to which this task belongs to.
